revised_title: Papers Read to the Royal Society: June 21, 1900
topics: Temperature and Elasticity in Metal Wires
tldr: This issue of the Proceedings of the Royal Society of London features a collection of papers on various scientific topics, including the effect of temperature on metal wire elasticity, the connection between glass' electrical properties and chemical composition, changes in iron's resistance due to magnetization, underground temperature measurements in Oxford, and the kinetic accumulation of stress through impulsive torsion.
